item.description:
How to create a successful business doing what you love
by RON WATSON


TURN YOUR TALENTS INTO INCOME AND OPPORTUNITIES


This program is not for the photographic "purist" who sees photography only as an art form and not as a potential business opportunity.  Why are 70% of today’s freelance writers and photographers working on a poverty level? If you're interested in creating business opportunities with your god-given talents and exploring ways to create income during these times of severe economic downturn, you will find this presentation fascinating and useful.
 

Discover the ultimate PR & publicity secrets, why some succeed and most fail.
Build a Media Kit and Press Release touting your talents and experience.
Let others sing your praise: collect testimonials from your satisfied customers.
The secret of finding a need & filling it, think like a business.
Set yourself apart from the crowd and become a specialist.
Informing potential buyers of your products and/or services.
Price determination without underselling yourself.
Discover the essential elements of marketing your product and self.
Easy steps to create a green screen portrait studio in your home or on location.
Generating leads and referrals, and much, much more!


Ron Watson is a 25 year veteran photo-journalist,  president of the American Press Association and author of a highly acclaimed book ”The Greatest Story Never Told”.

Ron’s authored hundreds of published articles, was a keynote speaker for The Whole Life Expo and The National Health Organization and spoke before numerous social and civic organizations throughout the U.S., bringing his message to thousands of individuals.  


His syndicated radio talk show, New Dimensions in Health,
has been heard coast to coast and he has been a frequent guest on national TV shows. He has worked with numerous national companies, as VP of sales and marketing.
He currently serves as staff photographer for the Marriott Hotel chain and was recently appointed as The Official Photographer for the Greater BostonConciergeAssociation. He continues expanding his photographic talents and contributions.
